campaign.story:
A Note On Shipping Costs and Customs Fees...
Postal fees have been rising substantially since our first Kickstarter campaign, back in 2017.  Ozone Productions has always absorbed these increases, but this year we have had to increase our shipping rates slightly. We are sorry prices are so high, but this reflects the current costs to package and mail your items. Likewise, we unfortunately cannot take responsibility for any additional customs fees/duties that international orders may receive.  So, please consider your total costs before pledging. 

We are still shipping to the UK. However, please be aware that because of new Brexit regulations implemented at the start of 2021, UK shipments may require an additional VAT payment.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is being produced by Olivia and Joel’s company Ozone Productions, Ltd. We have been in business for 45 years, and have published many calendars and books.

Details of the company history can be found in our company Creator Bio.

The design of this calendar is completed, and we have sourced all the materials needed. If we reach our Kickstarter goals, we will produce this product in timely fashion, and to the high standards our customers have come to expect from us. The previous four Kickstarter calendar projects were delivered on time and we expect the same this year!

Joel Beren
President
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Join the Private Records  music label and let's dig together for lost and unreleased 1970's and 1980's vintage music productions!
To the US dudes: We are able to ship from Berlin to the USA again!
It's obvious that the best source for unheard 1970's and 1980's music are unreleased songs and albums from old movies. Catherine Cherie is a Spanish/German coproduction flick from 1982. Typical 1980's b-movie stuff but with super nice music by Austrian cult musician "Gerhard Heinz".
This release will get distributed by our sublabel VAGIENNA (Vinyl Of Austria Group Vienna).
Catherine Cherie soundtrack is totally flashing us at Private Records at the moment because when dubbing the master tapes a lot unknown songs showed up. All in all we come about 17 songs including 2-3 bonus songs. Many songs are very long for a soundtrack production and ranging between 3 to nearly 6 minutes! Including magic psychedelic, cosmic disco, instrumental beats, ambient, crazy Jazz drums (always a nice source for sampling), afro drums...

An outstanding highlight is a psychedelic instrumental version of the title track which is popping up for only a second in the movie and is really fresh and unheard (one of the nearly 6 minutes songs). And also the vocal version of the movie theme sung by Austrian singer Pippa Armstrong (member of famous Austrian band „Die Schmetterlinge“) is a very very dope Disco song.

First 50 pink/white split color vinyl copies including an electronic vibrator as special feature for free!

Request a full stream of the album by sending a message to: info@priv4te.com
Audio snippets following soon!
About the movie: Extremely rare porn/erotic movie about a pop star and her erotic adventures. Starring "Rachel Evens" (also featured in this years release - Lolita Am Scheideweg), Berta Cabre and the transsexual porn actress "Ajita Wilson".

This is the 6th Private Records Kickstarter project! All succeeded!

The posters finally arrived on 23. December and the vinyls got started to get shipped out.
The Corana pandemic situation made it really difficult to deliver the vinyls right in time this year. Shipping to the USA is possible again but unfortunately the post don't allow sendings to the UK now. These orders get shipped out next month.

updates.update_userinfo: THE CATHERINE CHERIE VINYLS ARRIVED TODAY!
updates.update_content:
The Catherine Cherie vinyls arrived at the Private Records office today. A bit delayed but the whole Corona situation causing a lot problems in Germany at the moment. Especially the postal service is really bad. The packing material for sending out the vinyls was lost and had to get ordered it again. The posters did not arrive at the office and I requested a second shipping at the printing plant. As soon as the posters arrive the vinyls get send out. We are also still waiting for the Kickstarter money,.. Everything is complicated this year.
But the good news are that the vinyls really rule, awesome sound, top design. You'll love it!

campaign.story:
Funky beach vibes, psychedelic world music, sitar and cosmic synths produced by Austrian musician Gerhard Heinz in 1984 for the tropical porn movie "The Story Of The Dolls" aka "The Dolls" aka "Taifun Der Zärtlichkeit".
Tetchie Agbayani
Private Records digged out a new porn soundtrack which remained unreleased and was never available on vinyl before. This is our 4th Kickstarter project and 100 Private Records vinyl limited edition.
Join Private Records and let's dig together the music archives around the world to find lost and unreleased cosmic and psychedelic albums from the 1970's and 1980's!
"The Story Of The Dolls" was produced by cult porn Director "Hubert Frank" and featuring several Penthouse and Playboy aswell some famous 1980's hard core porn stars. The movie exist in 2 version uncut and TV version.
Brigitta Cimarolli and Carina Schally
This flick was filmed on the Philippines and telling the story of a photographer travelling through the tropical paradise with his model girls. The music is mega nice balearic funky and psychedelic, many long songs. 

Audio: 
17.06.2020: the vinyl testpressings arrived!
 Request a full stream of the album here: info@priv4te.com
Tetchie Agbayani
Tetchie Agbayani
Remastered from the original mastertapes. Mastercut and vinyl production by the old and famous Pallas company! 
Let's create togehter a new top vinyl collector item. The last Kickstarter vinyl limited edition by Private Records is completely sold out and selling now for 80-200 € on Discogs. So don't sleep on this one because this vinyl will be a sought after collector item soon, too.
https://www.discogs.com/Gerhard-Heinz-Lolita-Am-Scheideweg-Original-Motion-Picture-Soundtrack/release/14628916
This edition is limited to 100 copies on white/pink splattered vinyl, 200 copies on pink vinyl and 200 copies on black vinyl. The Kickstarter edition featuring a "Vinyl Is Sexy" heart sticker, poster insert and bandcamp download with a value of 15 €. Enjoy!

project_data.project_name: 1980's TROPICAL PORN SOUNDTRACK / THE STORY OF THE DOLLS

campaign.story:
Groovy funk, cosmic sitar beats, psychedelic flangers and chilled balearic disco songs produced by Austrian producer Gerhard Heinz in 1980! This album is a real surprise and going to be an awesome release for all fans of rare soundtracks, porn Disco, Jess Franco movies and obscure DJ tracks.
Private Records drops another gem on the Vagienna label right in time for christmas. The ridiculous German title of this soundtrack is already a reason for buying the vinyl: Lolita Am Scheideweg :) aka "Eugenie (Historia de una perversión) - Spain" and "Wicked Memoirs of Eugenie" US/international. This is the original porn B-movie soundtrack of the rare video nasty by Jess Franco. Soundtrack never before released on vinyl. Secure your record collector set on black or pink vinyl here. Limited to 250 copies each color and may soon be a sought after collector item as it happened with all the other porn soundtracks Private Records released before. 
Movie directed by Jess Franco and starring his wife Lina Romay aswell Katja Bienert who's famous for movies as for example Schulmädchen Report - The Naked Superwichtches of the Rio Amore and Derrick , Bea Fiedler, and many more... Spanish/German co-production produced by Lisa Film.
Lina Romay
This is the 3rd Private Records vinyl crowdfunding on Kickstarter and all in all the 7th. All of them succeeded! 
So join the Private Records project and let's dig togehter the archives around the world to save lost music and to produce unforgettable vinyl collector items.

campaign.story:
* * * 
Hey Everybody,
We're The Sterling Sisters, a band from Baltimore, Maryland. We've spent the last two years writing and performing, but with our first full-length album titled 'Hale' coming out, and the opportunity to support Slim Cessna's Auto Club on their upcoming tour, it's time to take our show on the road.

With your help we'll be able to play thirteen shows in the Midwest and Northeast (three of them in Canada), opening for Slim Cessna's Auto Club. All proceeds go directly to the van rental payment and for fuel for the first leg of the trip. We've got all sorts of rewards if you can help us out, not to mention a kick ass rock show if we're playing in your area.
Every donation, no matter what size, gets a thank-you on our website. We can't wait to see you all, and thanks for checking out the page!

Here's some nice things people have said about us:

"The Sterling Sisters are, comparatively, a new band in Baltimore that are quickly becoming one of the most recognizable sounds on the live music scene here. Their dark blend of Americana, neo-folk, country and post-punk is complex, vital and has teeth and tears for all. Without a doubt this is my favorite new band around, and they just released their first LP called 'Hale', which is an absolute triumph. Vocalists and song-writers George Cessna and Scout Pare-Phillips eschew the easy love song for the complicated ballad about loss, and turn family complexities into searingly-honest songs." -Guy Werner, Push Record Play
"…Baltimore's The Sterling Sisters, a group that makes some obvious nods to 16 Horsepower and other Old-Testament invoking goth-country bands. [With their] fiddle, guitar, banjo, drums, and a bassist endowed with a rafter-shaking operatic voice, the sound is full and commanding… They have a knack for the crescendo, taking plaintive country melodies and building them up into full on orchestrated barn-burners. I will admit that the lead singer's string bow-tie really brings it all full circle for me; he's like a singing cowboy that comes to you while you're trippin' balls." -Kevin Wesser, What Weekly 2012
Why Kickstarter?
Our goal is to cover the upfront costs of renting a van (no air conditioner needed) and gas expenses for the first leg of the tour.
The five of us have worked tirelessly on creating the ten best songs an album could have and touring the east coast perfecting our sound. 
Tour Itinerary
7/29 Minneapolis MN – 7th Street Entry
7/30 Chicago IL – Schubas Tavern
7/31 Detroit MI – Magic Stick
8/1 London ON – Call the Office
8/2 Toronto ON – Horseshoe Tavern
8/3 Ottawa ON – Babylon
8/4 Burlington VT – Signal Kitchen
8/5 Allston MA – Great Scott
8/6 New York NY – Santos Party House
8/7 Providence RI – The Met Cafe
8/8 Baltimore MD – Otto Bar
8/9 Philadelphia PA – North Star Bar
8/10 Pittsburgh PA – Rex Theater
Rewards
We've got a bunch of rewards for people kind enough to back our record and tour, including handwritten truck-stop postcards (while the tour), previous released tape sets, a Kickstarter only album, a Baltimore photo-book, guest passes, live acoustic show opportunities, and a wedding show!
Hale album cover
Pictured above: George performing with the guitar up for grabs!
Preview the first three tracks of Songs for the Donors
Who's releasing this?
Hale will be released on Pesanta Urfolk, a small independent record label specializing in ultra-limited, high-quality vinyl releases. Backers will get updates with everything going on with the release. 
When will Hale be released? 
After we get back home from tour, we'll get the Hale LP and rewards mailed out no later than the month of September!
www.thesterlingsisters.com
www.facebook.com/thesterlingsisters
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk against us are unforeseen obstacles that ultimately delay the pressing of Hale onto vinyl. As a band of individual artists, we would contact our backers immediately to accommodate our reward structure in a timely manner. Our backers mean the world to us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We look forward to seeing you soon, this tour or (hopefully) the next. Thank you.

campaign.story: After a hiatus of nearly 3 years, the Woodbox Gang has started recording a new album. We feel confident about our new material, and we decided to create a Kickstarter page in order help cover the production and manufacturing costs. There are several different levels of contributions available, each with a nice incentive for you. Our projected release date is October 2012. We greatly appreciate our loyal fanbase who haven't forgotten us during our hiatus, and we look forward to getting back to performing this coming fall. If you'd like to have a part in making the new CD, this is your opportunity. We are excited to share our new songs with you, and we hope to see you all very soon. Sincerely, Alex, Dan, Greg, and Hugh

Hello All,
     Only 15 days left to pre-order the new Woodbox Gang CD. We would like to send our gratitude to those who have so graciously contributed to our project. We'd like to ask you to help us with some grass roots promotion by sending a link to our Kickstarter project fundraiser/pre-order page to anyone who you feel might be interested in what we're doing. Thanks a bunch!

updates.update_userinfo: Woodbox Gang's project- only 15 Days remaining!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
 Thank you all so very much for contributing to our CD project. Our Kickstarter page will still be open until July 31 (that's 18 more days from now). If you know anyone who might like to pre-order our CD or take part in one of our other incentives, please send them a link. We feel very honored to have so many pre-orders, and we hope you all will enjoy the new CD when we release it. We are planning a CD release party, details will be announced soon. We hope you all will attend, because it's been way too long since we've seen you.

updates.update_userinfo: Project Update
updates.update_content:
Howdy Folks,
We would like to take this opportunity to sincerely thank everyone who has contributed to our new CD project. We would like to remind you that there is still time to contribute to the project, and thereby getting yourself a copy of the CD, or a poster, or if you really love the band, you can even get your name printed in the liner notes. If you know of a friend who likes The Woodbox Gang, please send them a link to this page. We need your help to network to all of our audience. There is no maximum number of pre-order copies of the CD, or posters, or room for names in the liner notes (we'll make it 20 pages long if we need to ;p). As always, we are an independent band with no major label support. We are dependent upon grass roots campaigns such as this in order to make our music available to you. Here's your chance to be a patron of the arts! Again, we thank you all so very much for your support! We couldn't do this without you (and why would we want to?)

updates.update_userinfo: Pre-order the new Woodbox Gang CD, there's still time!
updates.update_content: Howdy everybody, we are humbled and gracious for the rapid response to the launch of our Kickstarter page. We reached our minimum goal of $500 in less than 12 hours. We set the goal so low because according to Kickstarter's rules in order to actually collect the contributions, we must meet our minimum goal. But as you know, it costs a lot more than $500 to make a full length CD. Simply because we have reached our minimum goal doesn't mean that we will be shutting down the Kickstarter page. This Kickstarter page is set to end on July 31, so anyone who would like to pre-order the new Woodbox Gang CD will be able to do so until July 31, regardless of the fact that the minimum Kickstarter goal has been met. There will be no limit to the number of pre-orders we can collect. We will simply manufacture as many CDs and posters required to fill all of the pre-orders. Again, thank you all so very much. The Woodbox Gang

campaign.story:
It begins!!!!
As many of you may know, we at Murder By Death put out all of our own vinyl records. And you have always supported us with this endeavor. Thank you!  Now, some people might think vinyl records are an outdated technology but we feel very strongly, and we think you do too that vinyl not only delivers the highest quality sound experience, but can also be a thing of beauty. Presenting the art in glorious large format makes each record a keepsake and a treasure. OK, I'll get to the point. We want to continue to manufacture the best and most beautiful vinyl records out there and that ain't cheap. We have... a few years under our belts, so we have a lot of releases to keep in production. $$$$!  We are particularly proud of our latest recorded album "Bitter Drink, Bitter Moon" (Produced by John "Fabergé Eggs" Congleton) and we are teaming up with the fine folks at Bloodshot Records to release the CD and Digital THIS SEPTEMBER 25th... but we are still putting out the vinyl ourselves. And this time, we want to do it BIG!!!  We really can't wait for you to hear it, and we really want you to check out the vinyl. Lets not forget the art. The art is freaking great. You're going to want this beauty in your hands.
We understand that music itself is becoming less of a commodity. We don't feel like getting upset about this, we feel like making music that we think is missing from the world and we want to share it with people who give a care. We still need to make enough money to support 5 musicians ("We've got five mouths to feed!"-Total Recall) so we decided to get creative. What is and will always be a commodity is EXPERIENCES. Real, live memories. A show. A trip. An adventure. We are often asked to play weddings, parties, funerals. We would love to - really. Let's try to make it work. Often we are asked "why don't you cover this or that song?" OK, dare us. Want to head out with us on an adventure? Yep. So this is it! We found (we think) the perfect outlet to address this need we all have to EXPERIENCE each other and MUSIC, right here.  LET'S DO THIS!!!!
Oh look. It's us.
WHAT DO YOU GET FROM SUPPORTING THIS KICKSTARTER?
In addition to our intense gratitude and your new-found superior feeling of godliness ANY contributions will receive a DL SENT TO YOU IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS FROM THE NEW ALBUM. You will get an email with a link to download. You'll also get free downloads of any of the "MBD WILL COVER ANY SONG YOU WANT" covers assuming people buy those. Every physical order will come with a knick-knack from the band: a poster, a thank you letter, a comic book, stickers, whatever. Lastly, you will also have the knowledge that you are a superior person who supports the arts and saved the world. Oh, and if you donate over $100 you get this bitchin' patch!
Patch image coming soon!
WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT WHO WE ARE?
Known for their uniquely brooding sound that frequently conjures desolate imagery, on Bitter Drink, Bitter Moon Murder By Death capture a familiar tone but also explore new territory, adding a further refined sophistication and even richer, full-bodied sound. The varied album ranges musically from the spooky and spare opener “My Hill”, to the rough, rousing sing-along “Hard World”, to the booming, aching waltz of “Ghost Fields.” Songs like the cinematic “Lost River” start hushed before rising to a lush crescendo, while “No Oath, No Spell” maintains a dramatic, bluesy swing, and first single “I Came Around” rumbles and rollicks with a hard-charging, barroom flair. Singer Adam Turla’s cavernous baritone tells shadowy small-town stories throughout, the songs’ oftentimes-upbeat veneer belying a sordid undercurrent. Across Bitter Drink, Bitter Moon Sarah Balliet’s sonorous cello and Scott Brackett’s multiple instruments (backing vocals, piano, trumpet, and accordion, to name a few) weave irreplaceable accents, and Dagan Thogerson’s robust drums and Matt Armstrong’s inventive bass lines create a resounding low end.

Murder By Death wrote Bitter Drink, Bitter Moon – their first album featuring contributions from Brackett (formerly of Okkervil River and Shearwater)– throughout most of 2011, testing and reworking the songs in Turla’s basement-turned-practice-space. In January, they traveled to Dallas, TX to record with producer John Congleton (Explosions In The Sky, St. Vincent, Black Mountain) over three weeks. 
DAYTROTTER puts it "The stories that Turla writes and that the group brings to life - with a ruckus and the sound of a rambling train - are loaded with times and people that are the makings for the things that you get tattooed on your arms and shoulders, knowing that they're going to be the ones that stick with you until they are pale green and barely legible, as old age creeps onto the weathered skin. They are the fights that you lost that still taste salty at the corners of your mouth. They are the divorces and the foreclosures. They are the times when you feel like the only thing that's going to make anything feel better is to finish off that 12-pack yourself. They are the times that are your dark meanings, your true meanings."
WHAT COMES WITH THE NEW SPECIAL EDITION OF THE VINYL?
Wait til you see the final. We will add a picture of the exact product later...
DIE-CUT COVER, SO YOU CAN SEE THROUGH TO THE TRANSLUCENT VELLUM INTERIOR SLEEVE. THE RECORD ITSELF IS 180 GRAM AND COLORED TO LOOK LIKE A MOON. INSIDE YOU GET A CRAZY ZOETROPE (SEE DESCRIPTION BELOW IN THE FAQS) AND A GLOBE LANTERN PICTURED BELOW.
UPDATE: WE GOT PICS OF THE VINYL!
Die-cut Cover of the special vinyl
See thru the die-cut holes into the vellum sleeve
Close up of cover squigglies
Half the moons on the back are cut out to show the images on the vellum insert
Speckled moon vinyl!
ZOETROPE! (Cat not included)
GLOBE LANTERN!
WOAH! COOL. ITS A JAPANESE GLOBE LANTERN WITH OUR RECORD COVER ON IT. AMAZING
Tshirt mockup. Not my best photoshop work
FAQ'S!!!
WHEN DO I GET MY VINYL/CD/DIGITAL DL OF "BITTER DRINK, BITTER MOON"? It will ship to arrive by the release date of September 25th. You will get it a few days before it comes out in the store. You'll get the download of any covers people choose for us to do in January.
OK WHAT ABOUT MY FREE DOWNLOAD OF THE SINGLE FROM THE NEW ALBUM? OR WHAT ABOUT MY DOWNLOAD OF "LIKE THE EXORCIST..."?
That will show up a few days after you pledge. Its a lot of emails to send, but we will get to it, just give us a sec! 
WHAT'S EXCLUSIVE?
This is your only chance to join the MBD Whiskey Crew and patch up. Your only chance to get these rad posters, the golden ticket, the Forever Club, The MBD Book Club, The MBD covers, Buy Dagan a Tattoo, the full version of the special edition vinyl of Bitter Drink, Bitter Moon with all the trimmings, and of course these ridiculous trips with the band.
DOES THE NEW RECORD COME WITH DOWNLOAD CODES?
YES!!!!

WTF IS A TEST PRESSING?
A test pressing is a sample vinyl record the band listens to and approves so that the records that you lovely folks buy can go into production. We usually get 2-3 copies of these. We are offering you the only copy of each of our test pressings we will ever offer anyone. This is the limited of the limited.
WHAT THE HECK IS A ZOETROPE? Here it is! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YD11qsSezgQ&feature=youtu.be
It's basically an old school GIF. This one will sit and play on your record player. So sit and drink a whiskey and curl your mustache while you amuse yourself with this fun little knick-knack.Oh, and ours is reversible for twice the fun! Its like a starter jacket, but for music nerds!
WHAT DOES THE POSTER LOOK LIKE?
Oh, here!
OH look a vulture

WHAT COMES IN THE BOXED SET OF ALBUMS?
Like The Exorcist, But More Breakdancing 200 gram colored vinyl w/ color insert
Who Will Survive and What Will Be Left of Them? 200 gram colored vinyl w/ gatefold jacket w/ copper foil name
In Bocca Al Lupo 200 gram colored vinyl w/ color insert
Red Of Tooth and Claw 200 gram colored vinyl w/ gatefold jacket
Good Morning, Magpie 200 gram colored vinyl w/ embossed gatefold jacket & 12 page booklet
Bitter Drink, Bitter Moon 200 gram colored vinyl w/ zoetrope and globe lantern + cord kit
All in a copper foil covered box
OOH PRETTY!
BOOK CLUB? TELL ME MORE..
Pretty simple. We send you a book (that we love) once a month for a year. We inscribe it to you and tell you why we love it. We don't really make money on this one, but we think it's fun and getting stuff in the mail rules. 
IS SHIPPING INCLUDED?
YES. For everything.
MORE ON THE GOLDEN TICKET?
You email us at mbdband@gmail.com (hopefully with a few days notice) before one of our events you want to attend and we buy you tickets...however many times you wanna go! If we are opening a show we will do our damndest to make sure we still get you in. We can't guarantee festival entrance though. But any club dates and you're in! Plus you get a cool golden ticket.

WHAT IS GONNA BE ON THE FREE COVERS EP AND WHEN WILL I GET IT AND HOW?
You're gonna get any recordings of the covers people pay for us to do. We will record it at our local studio Farm Fresh Studios. Its free to all youse. It will come out in January and you will get an email with a link to download.
WILL DAGAN REALLY GET A TATTOO OF ANYTHING I WANT?
Yes. Just don't be a jerk. Be funny, be thoughtful, be crazy. Whatever.
JUST LOOK AT THIS GUY...
REMIND ME WHAT COMES WITH THE FOREVER CLUB?
It starts with a boxed set. Then, any time we put something out (vinyl, cds, tour posters, pint glasses, belt buckles, etc etc etc) we send you one. No fuss. We would send shirts but we make so many your closets would overflow. Plus you get a cool patch.
WILL YOU REALLY RECORD A COVER OF ANY SONG I WANT? EVEN STUFF YOU HATE?
Yes. And we hate a lot of stuff. But that could be interesting and cool. Sometimes the songs you don't expect to work turn out even better. OK ONE ADDENDUM- IT SHOULD BE A SONG THAT HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY RELEASED, PLEASE DON"T ASK US TO RECORD YOUR SONG, AS THAT KIND OF GOES AGAINST THE IDEA WE ARE TRYING TO GET ACROSS HERE.
TELL ME MORE ABOUT THESE HOUSE SHOWS YOU WILL PLAY...
Ok. We think this one is gonna rule. Some basic answers.
WHAT AM I BUYING WITH ALL THIS BIG MONIES? Well, you kinda choose. Adam and Sarah can come and do a show just the two of them. Or maybe you want all 5 band members. We play for an hour or so, a set list you choose in advance (you pick 12 songs, and we will pick the rest). It will most likely be an acoustic show to avoid police/ noise complaints. But if you have a spot that we aren't concerned about that, maybe it's a full electric rock show. We will hang out and party, but obviously, depending on the day, we eventually gotta take off at some point to get to the next show etc etc etc. It's probably regular show length. Like 3-4 hours. 
YES YOU CAN POOL YOUR MONEY TOGETHER WITH A BUNCH OF FRIENDS/ FAMILY. But please don't charge for the show. Ok, maybe you can pass around the hat or take donations or whatever. Maybe this is a gift for a couple. Or maybe the timing works out that we could play your wedding. Worth a shot. 
WHY SO EXPENSIVE? First of all, lets not forget kickstarter fees, transportation, accommodations, travel costs, crew, etc etc etc. We know a lot of you have asked us to play your events, and ask how much. We also know this is a lot of money, but this is what it will take to make a general price that includes anywhere in North America. If you are from somewhere other than North America, feel free to contact us, as we are totally open to playing your fine city in a far off land. YOU DON'T AUTOMATICALLY HAVE TO PAY MORE IF YOU ARE FROM FAR AWAY. IN FACT, WE LOVE TRAVELLING TO DISTANT LANDS. It just might take a moment to get us all there. Maybe you wanna do a destination show. That could be awesome. Email us at mbdband@gmail.com to discuss any serious inquiries. 
WE WILL ROCK YOU. PROBABLY ACOUSTICALLY.
I WANT TO HEAR MORE ABOUT THE CEDAR POINT TRIP...
We will arrange a time that works for both you and us. It will happen either this fall or next spring depending on what we can work out together. We book you and a friend flights/transportation to arrive in Cleveland/Sandusky, Ohio. The band picks you up in our tour van "The Pork Chop Express 5". We check you into your hotel in Cleveland. Then we sally forth to Cedar Point. Don't bother bringing cash- that's what your donation covers. We take you around the best roller coaster park in the world http://www.cedarpoint.com/ like kids in a candy shop. Play your heart out at silly games, ski ball, ring toss, video games, whatever! We dish out the cash and tokens. Ride 20 roller coasters. Eat junk food 'till you get sick, then ride 20 more roller coasters and get sick again. Gonna rule. A photographer will come along and document the whole day and will print up a hardcover book for you. 1 of a kind (OK, maybe we will get one too). Grab some dinner at a nice joint, and then we drop you off at your hotel, all tuckered out from your big day. Contact mbdband@gmail.com if you have any concerns/serious inquiries.
HEAR OUR PLEA! WE MUST RIDE ROLLER-COASTERS WITH YOU!
RIDE ROLLER COASTERS WITH US!
I WANT TO HEAR MORE ABOUT THE KENTUCKY BOURBON TRAIL BLOWOUT TRIP...
First of all, you and your companion need to be 21+. We fly/ arrange transport for you and a friend to Louisville, KY. You'll be picked up in a limo with MBD inside and will do a tour of the Kentucky Bourbon Trail http://kybourbontrail.com/index.php . Basically you visit distilleries with us all day and get wasted and hang. We check you into your fancy-ass hotel at http://www.21cmuseumhotels.com/louisville/ and then eat at their amazing restaurant. We'll try not to stink up the joint, but hey, I said we'll TRY. Let's see where the night takes us. Like the Cedar Point trip, we arrange the date of this trip with you and your companion- something that works for all of us. But we feel sooner is better than later, as you might die of anticipation, and we don't want that. This would be a rad gift for a wedding couple or something. Email mbdband@gmail.com with any serious inquiries/concerns.
AND YEA, WE SHALL DRINK BOURBON
EAT A FANCY DINNER WITH US AND THIS WALRUS
LASTLY, WE PICKED SOME ODD ADVENTURES THAT SOUNDED FUN TO US. IF YOU HAVE SOME OTHER CRAZY ADVENTURE IN MIND THAT'S MORE YOUR SPEED, AND WANT TO DROP THE DOUGH, FEEL FREE TO RUN IT BY US. EMAIL US AT mbdband@gmail.com . WE WILL CONSIDER IT. THANK YOU ALL FOR THE SUPPORT WE HAVE HAD OVER THE YEARS. YOU GUYS ARE SO RAD. WE LOVE YOU.
OH YEAH.
CREDITS: Kickstarter video by Mark Pallman of Fruitbonus Films
fruitbonusfilms.com    
Idea by Adam & Sarah (w/ help from Nick Cross) and Mark Pallman
OH YEAH... If you don't fancy any of this stuff... just come see us live!

campaign.story:
MANIFEST DESTINY by Renée Cinderhouse 
Featuring the Denver Broncos UK
Ever wish you could step out of your story and into another? Walk into a pop-up book or a Natural History Museum's diorama or your dreams just by walking through a door?
Then come with me and picture this:
Turn back the page of any book and let the book become bigger in your mind's eye, bigger than you, as big as houses. Now step behind the page as it opens. Enter the story, stepping under the tent-like embrace of the lifted page and enter a place made in 2 and 3 dimensions like a pop-up book. Like a book, this place allows travel outside the day-to-day and holds stains of time like a ghost town. 
Manifest Destiny exists at the intersection of personal and public memory. It is an artist designed room-sized installation, transforming a 2,500 sq. ft empty building into an immersive dream-like landscape. Inside a 14' tall forest are sculptural vignettes addressing American History, the Midwest as frontier and story-telling as the means to create personal and cultural identity. Featuring many live performances during its run, this multi-media sensory experience debuts September 7th, and runs through September 30th, 2012 at La Esquina. 
I am not looking to pay myself as I am used to funding my own studio practice. All proceeds from Kickstarter go directly toward acquisition of materials and talent to create this installation. I need theater curtains, scrim, lighting and sound equipment for the duration of the exhibit. There are printing and graphic design costs, performers, sound and lighting engineers, all who need to be compensated for their skills and time. In short, I need to underwrite the costs of creating a theater-like environment usually undertaken by a team of people working with a producer. I want to cut out this false need for a middle-man in our cultural exchanges; I need you.
Please consider that this $5,000 goal represents the bare minimum to make this project a reality; all funds raised over this goal still go directly toward production costs. The more money I am able to raise, the more this experience will be truly amazing for all of us...
This Kickstarter represents direct advance sales of the artwork. Each piece is hand-made by the artist in limited editions, each is an original. Consider this the official early-sneak-peek-patron-level-VIP-first-dibs on this work, brought to you straight from the artist herself. We don't need a middle-man to tell us what is worthy, I'm leaving that up to each of you to decide for yourselves.
If you aren't already aware, a traditional gallery arrangement with artists is a 50/50% split of the retail price of any artwork sold at an exhibition. This means that for artists not to screw themselves financially they typically have to price average potential collectors like you and I out of the market. This is a rare opportunity to purchase original art without the gallery mark-up.
I want you to have a piece of this storybook installation in sculpture. Whether you simply come to walk awhile in the space I am creating, letting the installation fill you to the brim with things you will never see anywhere else, or donate by buying one of my porcelain artifacts: Live with my art and let it become part of you. Put these precious objects on your nightstand. In your medicine cabinet. In your kitchen window. Anywhere you look every day and let me infuse a little more beauty into your mundane moments that otherwise go unnoticed and wash away into nothing. And I'll keep making them. Until everyone gets exactly what they were promised, artifacts of a once-in-a-lifetime experience, a piece of history. My work will become the future's archeology, your family heirlooms. 
So let's redefine how art reaches every one of us, and who gets to choose what art gets seen. Let's collectively re-write the stories we are telling as a culture. Let's take over where the news and politics leave us voiceless about the things that we really should be talking about. We write history together, we write tomorrow's memories. This is our story, we tell it any way we choose, as we see it rather than how the world sees us. 
www.manifestdestiny2012.wordpress.com
How to get what you want:
ALL PATRONS get mentioned by name on the Manifest Destiny website and access to advance ticket sales for Denver Broncos UK shows! The culminating event closing weekend September 28th-30th 2012!
*Since rewards are physically part of the Manifest Destiny installation, all rewards will be shipped at the close of the exhibit. Please note that SHIPPING COSTS are NOT INCLUDED in the donation levels. If you wish to have your rewards shipped to you PLEASE:
*All US Patrons please add $5 shipping and handling to your donation total; pricey for book pages, but cheap for porcelain axes. Please help me get all artwork shipped intact, thank you! 
*All International Patrons please add to your donation total $5 shipping and handling for paper, $20 for sculptures. This guarantees safe journey for your artifacts, thank you!
And now what you really want to see: lovely examples of each patron level. Please covet accordingly, and get one of each...

$10-$40 Patrons: Hand lettered names on vintage encyclopedia pages
Front and back 2 name page with President James Polk, and his wife Sarah Childress. Polk has been called the "least known consequential president", and his administration embraced the ideology of Manifest Destiny. He was also the first sitting president to be photographed. Each page measures 6.5" x 9.5" and is taken from an encyclopedia set published in 1954, first edition dating to 1919.  
Every page will be a part of Manifest Destiny; papering the entire entryway of the installation floor to ceiling 12' high, your names will start this project's story just as your names start funding it...
$50 Friend-Patrons: Limited edition numbered and signed art prints
Each patron receives an 18" x 24" print, and a 2 name vintage encyclopedia page of their choosing. First $50 donor receives #1 print.
$75 Friend-Patrons: Artist altered cabinet photograph
One-of-a-kind, each unique, original antique cabinet photograph cards dating from mid 1800s through early 1900s that have been altered by the artist. Each are dated and hand signed. Most cards measure approximately 4" x 6".
$100 Family-Patrons: Porcelain Fetus
Limited edition porcelain fetus numbered on its tiny forehead in Roman numerals, all one hundred of them (I-C). Each fetus measures 2" x 1" x 1.25" and are male or female. First $100 patron gets the first edition fetus.
$250 Family-Patrons: Porcelain goblet and plate place setting
Limited edition porcelain place setting: the plates hold ghosts of a meal; and the goblets are bitten on their drinking edge, each with its own unique teethprint. Goblets measure 4" x 4" x 6.5", plates 7.5" x 7.5" x 2", and the contents of the plates vary (silverware not included).
$500 Hero-Patrons: Porcelain femur
Some femurs are stained: smoke, fingerprints, dirt, ash. Some are pristine and plain, others bear words. Each femur measures 16.5" x 3.5" x 2.25". You also receive 2 tickets with patron-level seating to the Denver Broncos UK show of your choosing September 28th-30th 2012. 
$750 Hero-Patrons: Porcelain heart
Your heart is roughly the size of your fist; this one is about my true size. Each heart measures 5" x 3" x 2.5". You also receive 2 tickets with patron-level seating to the Denver Broncos UK show of your choosing September 28th-30th 2012.
$1000 Savior-Patrons: Porcelain axe
Hang it above your mantel, use it to slay invisible enemies or chop down imaginary trees...Each axe measures 27" x 5.5" x 1.25". You also receive 2 tickets with patron-level seating to the Denver Broncos UK show of your choosing September 28th-30th 2012.
$1250 Savior-Patrons: Porcelain book
Some books are closed, their stories never to be told; others remain blankly open, their stories waiting to be remembered. Some have stories carved into their pages, other stories run off the pages like blood. Books vary from dictionaries to storybooks to family albums...measuring from 8.5-10" x 6.75-13" x 1.25-2.75". You also receive 2 tickets with patron-level seating to the Denver Broncos UK show of your choosing September 28th-30th 2012.
Thank you for your time and generosity! 
Hope to see you there...
With regards,
Renée Cinderhouse

updates.update_userinfo: New process of experimentation
updates.update_content:
Hello all,
Thought I would share an experiment that grew out of the Manifest Destiny process. After the conclusion of the installation I continued working with the images from the original 1900s cabinet photo cards. I have now created porcelain versions of altered photos, in another attempt to re-write small parts of history...
Here are some of the very first I have made: the porcelain is high-fired and translucent, allowing a ghost image of the photo to show through onto the back of the card when held up to light.

updates.update_userinfo: Doing our share to keep America's mailmen employed...
updates.update_content:
Hello All!
Thanks to you, we mounted an amazing and unique project!
Featuring many talented musicians and performers, receiving great press and being voted best in Kansas City for 2012, Manifest Destiny was a resounding success!
The first and second batches of Kickstarter rewards have now been shipped and are coming soon to a mailbox near you...
I had originally anticipated getting all rewards out before the end of October as I had promised. However, the deinstall of the artwork took longer than expected and we are running a couple of weeks behind. After fully transforming the 2,500 sq ft gallery space into an immersive pop-up book forest, we had to take it all the way back to an empty white box again...

updates.update_userinfo: The official Charlotte Street Foundation announcement!
updates.update_content:
This week, Charlotte Street Foundation announced Manifest Destiny in their official biweekly email. CSF is the arts organization that hosts Manifest Destiny. They host, organize and sponsor a huge number of arts and cultural events, and the emails go to artists, collectors, cultural institutions, and anyone who wishes to join their mailing list. So, this is what showed up in our inbox earlier this week.
As the opening approaches, it's all becoming very very real.

campaign.story:
Slim Cessna's Auto Club
16 Horsepower
the Warlock Pinchers
DeVotchka
Munly
Paper Bird
Ian Cooke
Tarantella
Wovenhand
the Czars
the Swayback
the Kalamath Brothers
Foreskin 500
the Fluid
Boyd Rice/NON
Blood Axis
(and many, many more)
All musicians/bands that have stepped in to the North Denver home of Bob Ferbrache's mom over the past twenty years. The unassumingly suburban Ferbrache house is the location of Absinthe Studios and a hidden fulcrum of the local music scene. If you didn't know it was there, you'd drive right past it. If you didn't know who Bob was, you'd probably walk right past him in a bar, perhaps only pausing to notice his sweatpants and fanny pack.
While being the epicenter of the creation of the "Denver Sound" best described as a combination of gothic and country, Bob's studio has also been the home for acts as divergent as the lilting folk of Paper Bird, the anarchic craziness of the Warlock Pinchers to the dark industrial noise art of NON,
This documentary plans to follow both Bob's career as a musician and recordist, and thereby detail his overarching and profound effect upon the music scene of Denver. Using many hours of interviews, archival footage and more, this documentary hopes to provide a perspective of Denver's unique music scene, as heard through the ears of Bob Ferbrache.
Unlike most music documentaries, I plan on interviewing the bands, music journalists, promoters, etc. in groups rather than via a long series of one-on-one interviews. My hope is that this will create a much more organic and conversational tone (and be more insightful to the bands), rather than a staid group of talking heads. Unfortunately to do this well requires a much more challenging (and expensive) technical set-up for the interviews: multiple cameras, lighting, multi-track audio recording and the like. As such, the money raised will go to cover the production costs of the movie.
